original: 1. Soṇakoḷivisavatthu
analyzed: soṇa koḷi visa vatthu
translated: The account of Soṇa Koḷivisa

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha on the Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: Tena kho pana samayena rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro asītiyā gāmasahassesu issariyādhipaccaṁ rajjaṁ kāreti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena rājā māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ asītiyā gāma sahassesu issariya adhipaccam rajjam kāreti
translated: At that time King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha ruled over eighty thousand villages.

original: Tena kho pana samayena campāyaṁ soṇo nāma koḷiviso seṭṭhiputto sukhumālo hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena campāyam soṇaḥ nāma koḷivisaḥ seṭṭhi putto sukhumālaḥ hoti
translated: At that time in Campā there was a young man named Soṇa Koḷivisa, the son of a wealthy merchant.

original: Tassa pādatalesu lomāni jātāni honti.
analyzed: tassa pāda talesu lomāni jātāni honti
translated: He had soft and tender feet, and hair had grown between his toes.

original: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro tāni asīti gāmikasahassāni sannipātāpetvā kenacideva karaṇīyena soṇassa koḷivisassa santike dūtaṁ pāhesi—
analyzed: atha kho rājā māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ tāni asīti gāmika sahassāni sannipātāpetvā kenacid eva karaṇīyena soṇassa koḷivisassa santike dūtam pāhesi
translated: At that time King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha had gathered the eighty thousand village chiefs together for some business or other. He then sent a message to Soṇa Koḷivisa:

original: “āgacchatu soṇo, icchāmi soṇassa āgatan”ti.
analyzed: āgacchatu soṇaḥ icchāmi soṇassa āgatanti
translated: “Please come, Soṇa. I want you to come.”

original: Atha kho soṇassa koḷivisassa mātāpitaro soṇaṁ koḷivisaṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: atha kho soṇassa koḷivisassa mātā pitaraḥ soṇam koḷivisam etat avocuḥ
translated: Soṇa’s parents said to him,

original: “rājā te, tāta soṇa, pāde dakkhitukāmo.
analyzed: rājā te tāta soṇa pāde dakkhitu kāmo
translated: “Soṇa, the king wants to see your feet.

original: Mā kho tvaṁ, tāta soṇa, yena rājā tena pāde abhippasāreyyāsi.🔽Rañño purato pallaṅkena nisīda.
analyzed: mā kho tva tāta soṇa yena rājā tena pāde abhippasāreyyāsi  rañño puratas pallaṅkena nisīda
translated: Don’t put your feet up in front of the king.🔽Sit cross-legged in front of the king.

original: Nisinnassa te rājā pāde dakkhissatī”ti.
analyzed: nisinnassa te rājā pāde dakkhissati iti
translated: When you’re sitting down, the king will see your feet.”

original: Atha kho soṇaṁ koḷivisaṁ sivikāya ānesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho soṇam koḷivisam sivikāyaḥ ānesu
translated: So they brought Soṇa on a stretcher.

original: Atha kho soṇo koḷiviso yena rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā rājānaṁ māgadhaṁ seniyaṁ bimbisāraṁ abhivādetvā rañño purato pallaṅkena nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho soṇaḥ koḷivisaḥ yena rājā māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā rājānam māgadham seniyam bimbisāram abhivādetvā raññaḥ puratas pallaṅkena nisīdi
translated: He then went to King Bimbisāra, bowed, and sat down cross-legged in front of the king.

original: Addasā kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro soṇassa koḷivisassa pādatalesu lomāni jātāni.
analyzed: addasā kho rājā māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ soṇassa koḷivisassa pāda talesu lomāni jātāni
translated: The king saw that Soṇa’s feet had hair growing on the soles.🔽After instructing those eighty-four thousand landowning families in the present qualities, he dismissed them,

original: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro tāni asīti gāmikasahassāni diṭṭhadhammike atthe anusāsitvā uyyojesi—
analyzed: atha kho rājā māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ tāni asīti gāmika sahassāni diṭṭhadhammike atthe anusāsitvā uyyojesi
translated: saying,

original: “tumhe khvattha, bhaṇe, mayā diṭṭhadhammike atthe anusāsitā;🔽gacchatha, taṁ bhagavantaṁ payirupāsatha;
analyzed: tumhe khvattha bhaṇe mayā diṭṭhadhammike atthe anusāsitā  gacchatha tam bhagavantam payiḥ upāsatha
translated: “You have been instructed by me in the present qualities.🔽Go and attend on the Buddha.

original: so no bhagavā samparāyike atthe anusāsissatī”ti.
analyzed: saḥ naḥ bhagavā samparāyike atthe anusāsissati iti
translated: He will instruct you in the qualities of the next life.”

original: Atha kho tāni asīti gāmikasahassāni yena gijjhakūṭo pabbato tenupasaṅkamiṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho tāni asīti gāmika sahassāni yena gijjhakūṭaḥ pabbato tena upasaṅkamisu
translated: The eighty-thousand villagers went to the Vulture Peak.

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sāgato bhagavato upaṭṭhāko hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sāgataḥ bhagavataḥ upaṭṭhākaḥ hoti
translated: At that time Venerable Sāgata was the Buddha’s attendant.

original: Atha kho tāni asīti gāmikasahassāni yenāyasmā sāgato tenupasaṅkamiṁsu, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ sāgataṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: atha kho tāni asīti gāmika sahassāni yena āyasmā sāgato tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam sāgatam etat avocu
translated: The eighty-thousand villagers went to him and said,

original: “imāni, bhante, asīti gāmikasahassāni idhūpasaṅkantāni bhagavantaṁ dassanāya;
analyzed: imāni bhante asīti gāmika sahassāni idhu upasaṅkantāni bhagavantam dassanāya
translated: “Sir, we’ve come here to see the Buddha.

original: sādhu mayaṁ, bhante, labheyyāma bhagavantaṁ dassanāyā”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante labheyyāma bhagavantam dassanāya ati
translated: It would be good if we could see him.”

original: “Tena hi tumhe āyasmanto muhuttaṁ idheva tāva hotha, yāvāhaṁ bhagavantaṁ paṭivedemī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi tumhe āyasmantaḥ muhuttam idhā iva tāva hotha yāva aham bhagavantam paṭivedemi iti
translated: “Well then, please wait here for a moment while I inform the Buddha.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā sāgato tesaṁ asītiyā gāmikasahassānaṁ purato pekkhamānānaṁ pāṭikāya nimujjitvā bhagavato purato ummujjitvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā sāgataḥ tesam asītiyā gāmika sahassānam puratas pekkhamānānam pāṭikāya nimujjitvā bhagavataḥ puratas ummujjitvā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then, while the eighty-thousand villagers were watching, Sāgata submerged in the water in front of them and re-emerged in front of the Buddha. He said,🔽“Sir, the eighty-thousand villagers have come here to see you.

original: “imāni, bhante, asīti gāmikasahassāni idhūpasaṅkantāni bhagavantaṁ dassanāya;
analyzed: imāni bhante asīti gāmika sahassāni idhu upasaṅkantāni bhagavantam dassanāya
translated: “Venerable Sir, these eighty-thousand villagers have come to see the Buddha.

original: yassadāni, bhante, bhagavā kālaṁ maññatī”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ sadāni bhante bhagavā kālam maññati iti
translated: Please do what you think it is now time to do.”

original: “Tena hi tvaṁ, sāgata, vihārapacchāyāyaṁ āsanaṁ paññapehī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi tva sāgata vihāra pacchāya ayam āsanam paññapehi iti
translated: “Well then, Sāgata, prepare a seat in the shade of the dwelling.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti
analyzed: eva bhanta iti
translated: “Yes, Sir.”

original: kho āyasmā sāgato bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā pīṭhaṁ gahetvā bhagavato purato nimujjitvā
analyzed: kho āyasmā sāgataḥ bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā pīṭham gahetvā bhagavataḥ puratas nimujjitvā
translated: Sāgata took a chair, and while the eighty-thousand villagers were looking on, he sank into the water in front of them,

original: tesaṁ asītiyā gāmikasahassānaṁ purato pekkhamānānaṁ pāṭikāya ummujjitvā vihārapacchāyāyaṁ āsanaṁ paññapeti.
analyzed: tesam asītiyā gāmika sahassānam puratas pekkhamānānam pāṭikāya ummujjitvā vihāra pacchāyāyam āsanam paññapeti
translated: rose up with the chair in the water at the back of the dwelling, and prepared a seat in the shade of the dwelling.

original: Atha kho bhagavā vihārā nikkhamitvā vihārapacchāyāyaṁ paññatte āsane nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā vihārā nikkhamitvā vihāra pacchāya ayam paññatte āsane nisīdi
translated: The Buddha then came out of the dwelling and sat down on the prepared seat.

original: Atha kho tāni asīti gāmikasahassāni yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.🔽Atha kho tāni asīti gāmikasahassāni āyasmantaṁyeva sāgataṁ samannāharanti, no tathā bhagavantaṁ.
analyzed: atha kho tāni asīti gāmika sahassāni yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu 🔽atha kho tāni asīti gāmika sahassāni āyasmantayā iva sāgatam samannāharanti no tathā bhagavanta
translated: The eighty-thousand villagers then approached the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.🔽But they were more interested in Sāgata than in the Buddha.

original: Atha kho bhagavā tesaṁ asītiyā gāmikasahassānaṁ cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya āyasmantaṁ sāgataṁ āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā tesam asītiyā gāmika sahassānam cetasā cetaḥ upari vitakka maññāya āyasmantam sāgatam āmantesi
translated: Knowing their thoughts, the Buddha said to Venerable Sāgata,

original: “tena hi tvaṁ, sāgata, bhiyyoso mattāya uttari manussadhammaṁ iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ dassehī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi tva sāgata bhiyyosaḥ mattāya uttari manussa dhammam iddhi pāṭihāriyam dassehi iti
translated: “Well then, Sāgata, show them a further superhuman ability, a wonder of supernormal power.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā sāgato bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā vehāsaṁ abbhuggantvā ākāse
analyzed: eva bhanta iti kho āyasmā sāgataḥ bhagavataḥ paṭissuṇitvā vehāsam abbhuggantvā ākāse
translated: “Yes, sir,” Sāgata replied. He rose up into the air,

original: antalikkhe caṅkamatipi, tiṭṭhatipi, nisīdatipi, seyyampi kappeti, dhūmāyatipi pajjalatipi, antaradhāyatipi.
analyzed: antalikkhe caṅkamati pi tiṭṭhati pi nisīdati pi seyyampi kappeti dhūmāyati pi pajjalati pi antaradhāyati pi
translated: and while remaining there he walked back and forth, he stood, he sat down, and he lay down. He disappeared and reappeared. He emitted smoke and flames.

original: Atha kho āyasmā sāgato ākāse antalikkhe anekavihitaṁ uttari manussadhammaṁ iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ dassetvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā sāgataḥ ākāse antalikkhe aneka vihitam uttari manussa dhammam iddhi pāṭihāriyam dassetvā bhagavataḥ pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: After showing various kinds of superhuman abilities, various kinds of supernormal power, he bowed down at the Buddha’s feet and said,

original: “satthā me, bhante, bhagavā;
analyzed: satthā me bhante bhagavā
translated: “Sir, the Buddha is my teacher.

original: sāvakohamasmi.
analyzed: sāvakaḥ ham asmi
translated: I’m his disciple.

original: Satthā me, bhante, bhagavā;
analyzed: satthā me bhante bhagavā
translated: The Buddha is my teacher.

original: sāvakohamasmī”ti.
analyzed: sāvakā uham asmi iti
translated: I’m his disciple.”

original: Atha kho tāni asīti gāmikasahassāni “acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho.
analyzed: atha kho tāni asīti gāmika sahassāni acchariyam vata bho abbhutam vata bho
translated: “It’s amazing, it’s astounding—

original: Sāvakopi nāma evaṁ mahiddhiko bhavissati, evaṁ mahānubhāvo, aho nūna satthā”ti bhagavantaṁyeva samannāharanti, no tathā āyasmantaṁ sāgataṁ.
analyzed: sāvakaḥ api nāma evam mahiddhikaḥ bhavissati evam mahā anubhāvaḥ aho nūna satthā ati bhagavantayā iva samannāharanti no tathā āyasmantam sāgata
translated: how great is the power and might of the Buddha, in that even his disciple has such great power and might!” And they turned their full attention to the Buddha, not to Venerable Sāgata.

original: Atha kho bhagavā tesaṁ asītiyā gāmikasahassānaṁ cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā tesam asītiyā gāmika sahassānam cetasā cetaḥ upari vitakka maññāya anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: Then the Buddha, having known with his awareness the train of thought in the minds of those eighty-four thousand people, gave a step-by-step talk:

original: dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ, kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ, nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
analyzed: dāna katham sīla katham sagga katha kāmānam ādīnavam okāram saṅkilesa nekkhamme ānisasam pakāsesi
translated: a talk on generosity, on virtue, on heaven; and he declared the drawbacks, degradation, and defilement in worldly pleasures, and the rewards of renunciation.

original: Yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kallacitte, muducitte, vinīvaraṇacitte, udaggacitte, pasannacitte, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā, taṁ pakāsesi—
analyzed: yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kalla citte mudu citte vinīvaraṇa citte udagga citte pasanna citte atha yā buddhānam sāmukkasikā dhamma desanā tam pakāsesi
translated: When the Buddha knew that their minds were ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:

original: dukkhaṁ, samudayaṁ, nirodhaṁ, maggaṁ.
analyzed: dukkha samudaya nirodha magga
translated: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma suddham vattham apagata kāḷakam sammat eva rajanam paṭiggaṇheyya
translated: Just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

original: evamevaṁ tesaṁ asītiyā gāmikasahassānaṁ tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi—
analyzed: evam evam tesam asītiyā gāmika sahassānam tasmiyā eva āsane virajam vīta malam dhamma cakkhum udapādi
translated: so too, while they were sitting right there, those eighty thousand village overseers experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

original: “yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman”ti.
analyzed: yam kiñci samudaya dhammam sabbam tat nirodha dhamman ti
translated: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”

original: Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: te diṭṭha dhammā patta dhammā vidita dhammā pariyogāḷha dhammā tiṇṇa vicikicchāḥ vigata kathaṅkathāḥ vesārajja ppattāḥ apara paccayā satthu sāsane bhagavantam etat avocu
translated: They had seen the Truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. They had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction. They then said to the Buddha,

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.🔽Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya—
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante abhikkanta bhante  seyyathā api bhante nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya
translated: “Wonderful, Sir, wonderful!

original: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: Just as one might set upright what had been overturned, or reveal what was hidden, or show the way to one who was lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what’s there—

original: evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhagavatā aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: just so has the Buddha made the Teaching clear in many ways.

original: Ete mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāma.
analyzed: ete bhante bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāma
translated: We go for refuge to the Buddha,

original: Dhammañca, bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: the Dhamma, and the Saṅgha of monks.

original: Upāsake no bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupete saraṇaṁ gate”ti.
analyzed: upāsake naḥ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupete saraṇam gata iti
translated: Please accept us as lay followers who have gone for refuge for life.”

original: 1.1. Soṇassapabbajjā
analyzed: soṇassapabbajjā
translated: .. The going forth of Soṇa

original: Atha kho soṇassa koḷivisassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho soṇassa koḷivisassa etat ahosi
translated: Then Soṇa thought,

original: “yathā yathā kho ahaṁ bhagavatā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmi, nayidaṁ sukaraṁ agāraṁ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṁ ekantaparisuddhaṁ saṅkhalikhitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ;
analyzed: yathā yathā kho aham bhagavatā dhammam desitam ājānāmi na idam sukaram agāram ajjhāvasatā ekanta paripuṇṇam ekanta parisuddham saṅkha likhitam brahmacariyam caritu
translated: “As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, it’s not easy for one who lives at home to lead the spiritual life perfectly complete and pure as a polished conch shell.

original: yannūnāhaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajeyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajeyyanti
translated: Why don’t I shave off my hair and beard, put on the ocher robes, and go forth into homelessness?”

original: Atha kho tāni asīti gāmikasahassāni bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkamiṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho tāni asīti gāmika sahassāni bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkamisu
translated: After rejoicing in and approving of the Buddha’s words, the eighty-thousand villagers got up from their seats, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with their right side toward him, and left.

original: Atha kho soṇo koḷiviso acirapakkantesu tesu asītiyā gāmikasahassesu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho soṇo koḷiviso bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho soṇaḥ koḷivisaḥ acira pakkantesu tesu asītiyā gāmika sahassesu yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi  ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho soṇaḥ koḷivisaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Soon after they had left, Soṇa went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: “yathā yathāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmi, nayidaṁ sukaraṁ agāraṁ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṁ ekantaparisuddhaṁ saṅkhalikhitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ.
analyzed: yathā yathā āha bhante bhagavatā dhammam desitam ājānāmi na idam sukaram agāram ajjhāvasatā ekanta paripuṇṇam ekanta parisuddham saṅkha likhitam brahmacariyam caritu
translated: and said, “Sir, as I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, it’s not easy for one who lives at home to lead the spiritual life perfectly complete and pure as a polished conch shell.

original: Icchāmahaṁ, bhante, kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajituṁ.
analyzed: icchāmaha bhante kesa massum ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitu
translated: I wish to shave off my hair and beard, put on the ocher robes, and go forth into homelessness.

original: Pabbājetu maṁ, bhante, bhagavā”ti.🔽Alattha kho soṇo koḷiviso bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, alattha upasampadaṁ.
analyzed: pabbājetu ma bhante bhagavā ati  alattha kho soṇaḥ koḷivisaḥ bhagavato santike pabbajja alattha upasampada
translated: Please give me permission.”🔽Soṇa received the going forth and the full ordination in the Buddha’s presence.

original: Acirupasampanno ca panāyasmā soṇo sītavane viharati.
analyzed: acira upasampannaḥ ca pana ayasmā soṇaḥ sītavane viharati
translated: Soon after his full ordination, Venerable Soṇa was staying at Cool Grove.

original: Tassa accāraddhavīriyassa caṅkamato pādā bhijjiṁsu.
analyzed: tassa accāraddha vīriyassa caṅkamataḥ pādāḥ bhijjisu
translated: Because of his excessive energy, his feet split open while he was walking for exercise.

original: Caṅkamo lohitena phuṭo hoti, seyyathāpi gavāghātanaṁ.
analyzed: caṅkamaḥ lohitena phuṭaḥ sā iyyathā api gavāghātana
translated: The walkway was covered in blood, as if a slaughterhouse.

original: Atha kho āyasmato soṇassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ soṇassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi
translated: Then, while reflecting in private, Venerable Soṇa thought,

original: “ye kho keci bhagavato sāvakā āraddhavīriyā viharanti, ahaṁ tesaṁ aññataro.
analyzed: ye kho keci bhagavataḥ sāvakāḥ āraddha vīriyāḥ viharanti aham tesam aññataraḥ
translated: “I’m one of the Buddha’s energetic monks,

original: Atha ca pana me nānupādāya āsavehi cittaṁ vimuccati.
analyzed: atha ca pana me na an upādāya āsavehi cittam vimuccati
translated: but my mind isn’t freed from the corruptions through letting go.

original: Saṁvijjanti kho pana me kule bhogā;🔽sakkā bhoge ca bhuñjituṁ, puññāni ca kātuṁ.
analyzed: savijjanti kho pana me kule bhogāḥ  sakkā bhoge ca bhuñjitu puññāni ca kātu
translated: And there’s wealth in my family.🔽I can enjoy it and make merit.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ hīnāyāvattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjeyyaṁ, puññāni ca kareyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham hīnāya avattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjeyya puññāni ca kareyyanti
translated: Why don’t I return to the lower life and enjoy my wealth and make merit?”

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmato soṇassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā āyasmataḥ soṇassa cetasā cetaḥ upari vitakka maññāya
translated: The Buddha read Soṇa’s mind.

original: seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—gijjhakūṭe pabbate antarahito sītavane pāturahosi.
analyzed: sa iyyathā api nāma balavā purisaḥ samiñjitam vā bāham pasāreyya pasāritam vā bāham samiñjeyya evam eva gijjhakūṭe pabbate antarahitaḥ sītavane pāturahosi
translated: Just as a strong man might bend or stretch his arm, the Buddha disappeared from the Vulture Peak and reappeared in the Cool Grove.

original: Atha kho bhagavā sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṁ senāsanacārikaṁ āhiṇḍanto yenāyasmato soṇassa caṅkamo tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhim senāsana cārikam āhiṇḍantaḥ yena āyasmataḥ soṇassa caṅkamo tena upasaṅkami
translated: Then, while walking about the dwellings with a number of monks, the Buddha came to Soṇa’s walking path.

original: Addasā kho bhagavā āyasmato soṇassa caṅkamaṁ lohitena phuṭaṁ, disvāna bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: addasā kho bhagavā āyasmataḥ soṇassa caṅkamam lohitena phuṭa disvāna bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: He saw that it was covered in blood and said to the monks,

original: “kassa nvāyaṁ, bhikkhave, caṅkamo lohitena phuṭo, seyyathāpi gavāghātanan”ti?
analyzed: kassa nvāya bhikkhave caṅkamaḥ lohitena phuṭaḥ seyyathā api gavāghātananti
translated: “Whose walking path is this, as if a cow has been slaughtered here?”

original: “Āyasmato, bhante, soṇassa accāraddhavīriyassa caṅkamato pādā bhijjiṁsu.
analyzed: āyasmataḥ bhante soṇassa acca āraddha vīriyassa caṅkamataḥ pādāḥ bhijjisu
translated: “Sir, Soṇa’s feet split while he was walking too fast.

original: Tassāyaṁ caṅkamo lohitena phuṭo, seyyathāpi gavāghātanan”ti.
analyzed: tassa ayam caṅkamaḥ lohitena phuṭaḥ sā iyyathā api
translated: That’s why this walking path is covered in blood, as if a cow has been slaughtered here.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā yenāyasmato soṇassa vihāro tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā yena ayasmataḥ soṇassa vihāro tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
translated: The Buddha then went to Soṇa’s dwelling and sat down on the prepared seat.

original: Āyasmāpi kho soṇo bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: āyasmā api kho soṇaḥ bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: Soṇa bowed and sat down,

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho āyasmantaṁ soṇaṁ bhagavā etadavoca—
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnam kho āyasmantam soṇam bhagavān etat avoca
translated: and the Buddha said to him,

original: “nanu te, soṇa, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
analyzed: nanu te soṇa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi
translated: “Soṇa, didn’t you have this thought while you were in seclusion:

original: ‘ye kho keci bhagavato sāvakā āraddhavīriyā viharanti, ahaṁ tesaṁ aññataro.
analyzed: ye kho keci bhagavataḥ sāvakāḥ āraddha vīriyāḥ viharanti aham tesam aññataraḥ
translated: ‘I’m one of the Buddha’s energetic disciples,

original: Atha ca pana me nānupādāya āsavehi cittaṁ vimuccati.
analyzed: atha ca pana me na an upādāya āsavehi cittam vimuccati
translated: but I’m still not free from the corruptions with the ending of greed, hate, and delusion.

original: Saṁvijjanti kho pana me kule bhogā;🔽sakkā bhoge ca bhuñjituṁ, puññāni ca kātuṁ.
analyzed: savijjanti kho pana me kule bhogāḥ  sakkā bhoge ca bhuñjitu puññāni ca kātu
translated: And there’s wealth in my family.🔽I can enjoy it and make merit.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ hīnāyāvattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjeyyaṁ, puññāni ca kareyyan’”ti?
analyzed: yat nūna aham hīnāya avattitvā bhoge ca bhuñjeyya puññāni ca kareyyanti
translated: Why don’t I return to the lower life and enjoy my wealth and make merit?’”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti.
analyzed: eva bhanta iti
translated: “Yes, Sir.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, soṇa, kusalo tvaṁ pubbe agārikabhūto vīṇāya tantissare”ti?
analyzed: tam kim maññasi soṇa kusalo tvam pubbe agārika bhūtaḥ vīṇāya tantissara iti
translated: “What do you think, Soṇa? When you were a layman, were you skilled at playing the lute?”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti.
analyzed: eva bhanta iti
translated: “Yes, Sir.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, soṇa, yadā te vīṇāya tantiyo accāyatā honti, api nu te vīṇā tasmiṁ samaye saravatī vā hoti, kammaññā vā”ti?
analyzed: tam kim maññasi soṇa yadā te vīṇāya tantiyaḥ accāyatāḥ honti api nu te vīṇā tasmin samaye saravatī vā hoti kammaññā vāti
translated: “What do you think, Soṇa? When the strings of your lute were too tight, was your lute well tuned and easy to play?”

original: “No hetaṁ, bhante”ti.
analyzed: na u heta bhanta iti
translated: “No, Sir.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, soṇa, yadā te vīṇāya tantiyo atisithilā honti, api nu te vīṇā tasmiṁ samaye saravatī vā hoti, kammaññā vā”ti?
analyzed: tam kim maññasi soṇa yadā te vīṇāya tantiyaḥ ati sithilāḥ honti api nu te vīṇā tasmin samaye saravatī vā hoti kammaññā vāti
translated: “What do you think, Soṇa? When the strings of your vīnā were too loose, was your vīnā tuneful and playable?”

original: “No hetaṁ, bhante”ti.
analyzed: na u heta bhanta iti
translated: “No, venerable sir.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, soṇa, yadā te vīṇāya tantiyo neva accāyatā honti nātisithilā, same guṇe patiṭṭhitā, api nu te vīṇā tasmiṁ samaye saravatī vā hoti, kammaññā vā”ti?
analyzed: tam kim maññasi soṇa yadā te vīṇāya tantiyaḥ na iva accāyatāḥ honti na ati sithilā same guṇe patiṭṭhitā api nu te vīṇā tasmin samaye saravatī vā hoti kammaññā vāti
translated: “What do you think, Soṇa? When the strings of your vīnā were neither too taut nor too loose but set to an even tension, was your vīnā tuneful and playable then?”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti.
analyzed: eva bhanta iti
translated: “Yes, venerable sir.”

original: “Evameva kho, soṇa, accāraddhavīriyaṁ uddhaccāya saṁvattati, atilīnavīriyaṁ kosajjāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: evam eva kho soṇa accāraddha vīriyam uddhaccāya savattati atilīna vīriyam kosajjāya savattati
translated: “So too, Soṇa, excessive energy leads to restlessness and deficient energy to indolence.

original: Tasmātiha tvaṁ, soṇa, vīriyasamataṁ adhiṭṭhaha, indriyānañca samataṁ paṭivijjha, tattha ca nimittaṁ gaṇhāhī”ti.
analyzed: tasmā ati ha tva soṇa vīriya samatam adhiṭṭhaha indriyānam ca samatam paṭivijjha tattha ca nimittam gaṇhāhi iti
translated: Therefore, Soṇa, be moderate in your energy, and penetrate the equanimity of the faculties. And you should find a meditation subject that is neither too far off nor too near.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā soṇo bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho āyasmā soṇaḥ bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, venerable sir,” the venerable Soṇa replied.

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ soṇaṁ iminā ovādena ovaditvā—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyasmantam soṇam iminā ovādena ovaditvā aseyyathā api nāma balavā purisaḥ
translated: Then, after instructing the venerable Soṇa in many ways,

original: samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—sītavane āyasmato
analyzed: samiñjitam vā bāham pasāreyya pasāritam vā bāham samiñjeyya evam eva sītavane
translated: just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm, or flex his extended arm, so too, the venerable

original: soṇassa sammukhe antarahito gijjhakūṭe pabbate pāturahosi.
analyzed: soṇassa sammukhe antarahitaḥ gijjhakūṭe pabbate pāturahosi
translated: and he extended his arm, which was bent, and bent his arm, which was extended. In the same way, he disappeared from the Cool Grove and reappeared on the Vulture Peak in front of Venerable Sāriputta.

original: Atha kho āyasmā soṇo aparena samayena vīriyasamataṁ adhiṭṭhāsi, indriyānañca samataṁ paṭivijjhi, tattha ca nimittaṁ aggahesi.🔽Atha kho āyasmā soṇo, eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto, na cirasseva—yassatthāya🔽kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraṁ—brahmacariyapariyosānaṁ
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā soṇaḥ aparena samayena vīriya samatam adhiṭṭhāsi indriyānam ca samatam paṭivijjhi tattha ca nimittam aggahesi  atha kho āyasmā soṇaḥ ekaḥ vūpakaṭṭhaḥ appamattaḥ ātāpī pahitattaḥ viharantaḥ na  kula puttā sammad eva agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajanti tad anuttara brahmacariya pariyosāna
translated: Then, some time later, Venerable Soṇa resolved on the balance of energy and penetrated the equanimity of the faculties. He then took up the meditation object there.🔽Then, dwelling alone, withdrawn, heedful, ardent, and resolute, Venerable Soṇa, by realising for himself with direct knowledge,

original: diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
analyzed: diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi
translated: here and now entered and remained in that supreme goal of the holy life for which clansmen rightly go forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: “Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā”ti abhiññāsi.
analyzed: brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati abhiññāsi
translated: He directly knew: “Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.”

original: Aññataro ca panāyasmā soṇo arahataṁ ahosi.
analyzed: aññataro ca pana ayasmā soṇaḥ arahatam ahosi
translated: And Venerable Soṇa became another one of the arahants.

original: Atha kho āyasmato soṇassa arahattappattassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ soṇassa arahatta ppattassa etat ahosi
translated: After attaining perfection, Venerable Soṇa thought,

original: “yannūnāhaṁ bhagavato santike aññaṁ byākareyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham bhagavato santike aññam byākareyyanti
translated: “Why don’t I declare final knowledge in the presence of the Buddha?”

original: Atha kho āyasmā soṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmā soṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: He then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā soṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: eka mantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmā soṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said,

original: “yo so, bhante, bhikkhu arahaṁ khīṇāsavo vusitavā katakaraṇīyo ohitabhāro anuppattasadattho parikkhīṇabhavasaṁyojano sammadaññāvimutto, so chaṭṭhānāni adhimutto hoti—
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ bhante bhikkhu araham khīṇa āsavaḥ vusitavā kata karaṇīyaḥ ohita bhāraḥ an uppatta sadattho parikkhīṇa bhava sayojanaḥ sammad aññā vimutto saḥ cha ṭṭhānāni adhimuttaḥ hoti
translated: “Venerable Sir, a monk who is perfected, with defilements ended, who has completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, attained the true goal, destroyed the fetters of rebirth, and is completely liberated through final knowledge, is intent on six things:

original: nekkhammādhimutto hoti, pavivekādhimutto hoti, abyāpajjādhimutto hoti, upādānakkhayādhimutto hoti, taṇhakkhayādhimutto hoti, asammohādhimutto hoti.
analyzed: nekkhamma adhimuttaḥ hoti paviveka adhimuttaḥ hoti abyāpajja adhimuttaḥ hoti upādāna khaya adhimuttaḥ hoti taṇhā khaya adhimuttaḥ hoti asammoha adhimuttaḥ hoti
translated: renunciation, seclusion, imperturbability, the ending of grasping, the ending of craving, and non-confusion.

original: Siyā kho pana, bhante, idhekaccassa āyasmato evamassa—
analyzed: siyā kho pana bhante idha ekaccassa āyasmataḥ evamassa
translated: Venerable Sir, it’s possible that some of my fellow monastics might think,

original: ‘kevalaṁ saddhāmattakaṁ nūna ayamāyasmā nissāya nekkhammādhimutto’ti, na kho panetaṁ, bhante, evaṁ daṭṭhabbaṁ.
analyzed: kevalam saddhā mattakam nūna ayam āyasmā nissāya nekkhamma adhimuttaḥ ti na kho pana ita bhante evam daṭṭhabba
translated: ‘This venerable one is intent on renunciation because of mere faith alone,’ but that is not the way to see it.

original: Khīṇāsavo, bhante, bhikkhu, vusitavā, katakaraṇīyo, karaṇīyamattānaṁ asamanupassanto
analyzed: khīṇāsavaḥ bhante bhikkhu vusitavā kata karaṇīyaḥ karaṇīya mattānam a samanupassantaḥ
translated: A bhikkhu whose taints are destroyed, who has lived the spiritual life, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, reached his own goal, utterly destroyed the fetters of existence, and is completely liberated through final knowledge,🔽is intent on renunciation because of the destruction of lust, because of the fading away of lust.

original: katassa vā paṭicayaṁ khayā rāgassa vītarāgattā nekkhammādhimutto hoti, khayā dosassa
analyzed: katassa vā paṭicayam khayā rāgassa vīta rāga ttā nekkhamma adhimutto hoti khayā dosassa
translated: He is intent on renunciation because of the destruction of hatred, because of the fading away of hatred.

original: vītadosattā nekkhammādhimutto hoti, khayā mohassa vītamohattā nekkhammādhimutto hoti.
analyzed: vīta dosa ttā nekkhamma adhimutto hoti khayā mohassa vīta moha ttā nekkhamma adhimutto hoti
translated: He is intent on renunciation because of the destruction of delusion, because of the fading away of delusion.

original: Siyā kho pana, bhante, idhekaccassa āyasmato evamassa—
analyzed: siyā kho pana bhante idha ekaccassa āyasmataḥ evamassa
translated: Venerable sir, it might be that some venerable one here thinks thus:

original: ‘lābhasakkārasilokaṁ nūna ayamāyasmā nikāmayamāno pavivekādhimutto’ti.
analyzed: nūna ayam āyasmā nikāmayamānaḥ paviveka adhimuttaḥ ti
translated: ‘This venerable one is intent on solitude because of a desire for self-identification, a desire for fame, or a desire for gain, honour, and praise.’

original: Na kho panetaṁ, bhante, evaṁ daṭṭhabbaṁ.
analyzed: na kho pana ita bhante evam daṭṭhabba
translated: But that is not the way to see it.

original: Khīṇāsavo, bhante, bhikkhu, vusitavā, katakaraṇīyo, karaṇīyamattānaṁ asamanupassanto
analyzed: khīṇāsavaḥ bhante bhikkhu vusitavā kata karaṇīyaḥ karaṇīya mattānam a samanupassantaḥ
translated: A bhikkhu whose taints are destroyed, who has lived the spiritual life, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, reached his own goal, utterly destroyed the fetters of existence, and is completely liberated through final knowledge,

original: katassa vā paṭicayaṁ, khayā rāgassa vītarāgattā pavivekādhimutto hoti, khayā dosassa
analyzed: katassa vā khayā rāgassa vīta rāga ttā paviveka adhimutto hoti khayā dosassa
translated: or for one who has done, to preserve what has been done.🔽With the destruction of greed, he is intent on solitude through being free from greed.🔽With the destruction of hatred, he is intent on solitude through being free from hatred.

original: vītadosattā pavivekādhimutto hoti, khayā mohassa vītamohattā pavivekādhimutto hoti.
analyzed: vīta dosa ttā paviveka adhimutto hoti khayā mohassa vīta moha ttā paviveka adhimutto hoti
translated: With the destruction of delusion, he is intent on solitude through being free from delusion.

original: Siyā kho pana, bhante, idhekaccassa āyasmato evamassa—
analyzed: siyā kho pana bhante idha ekaccassa āyasmataḥ evamassa
translated: “It may be, venerable sir, that some venerable one here thinks:

original: ‘sīlabbataparāmāsaṁ nūna ayamāyasmā sārato paccāgacchanto abyāpajjādhimutto’ti.
analyzed: nūna ayam āyasmā sārataḥ paccāgacchantaḥ a byāpajja adhimuttaḥ ti
translated: ‘Surely, this venerable one is intent on solitude through being devoted to the practice of scrutinizing his own behavior.’

original: Na kho panetaṁ, bhante, evaṁ daṭṭhabbaṁ.
analyzed: na kho pana ita bhante evam daṭṭhabba
translated: But that, venerable sir, should not be seen in such a way.

original: Khīṇāsavo, bhante, bhikkhu, vusitavā, katakaraṇīyo, karaṇīyamattānaṁ asamanupassanto🔽katassa vā paṭicayaṁ, khayā rāgassa vītarāgattā abyāpajjādhimutto hoti, khayā dosassa

analyzed: paññattāni honti bahi pi mañce paññattāni honti antar pi pīṭhe paññattāni honti bahi pi  pīṭhe paññattāni honti
translated: They were spread on the bed, on the bench, and on the floor around the bed.

original: Aññataropi pāpabhikkhu aññatarassa pāpupāsakassa kulūpako hoti.
analyzed: aññataraḥ api pāpa bhikkhu aññatarassa pāpa upāsakassa kulūpakaḥ hoti
translated: A certain bad monk was a regular visitor to the house of a certain bad lay follower.

original: Atha kho so pāpabhikkhu pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena tassa pāpupāsakassa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ pāpa bhikkhu pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena tassa pāpa upāsakassa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
translated: One morning that bad monk robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to that lay follower’s house, where he sat down on the prepared seat.

original: Atha kho so pāpupāsako yena so pāpabhikkhu tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṁ pāpabhikkhuṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ pāpa upāsakaḥ yena saḥ pāpa bhikkhu tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā tam pāpa bhikkhum abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: That bad lay follower then approached that bad monk, bowed, and sat down.

original: Tena kho pana samayena tassa pāpupāsakassa vacchako hoti taruṇako abhirūpo dassanīyo pāsādiko citro, seyyathāpi dīpicchāpo.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena tassa pāpupāsakassa vacchakaḥ hoti taruṇakaḥ abhirūpaḥ dassanīyaḥ pāsādiko citro seyyathā api dīpi chāpaḥ
translated: At that time that lay follower had a young calf that was beautiful, good-looking, and attractive, with a colorful coat like a peacock’s tail.

original: Atha kho so pāpabhikkhu taṁ vacchakaṁ sakkaccaṁ upanijjhāyati.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ pāpa bhikkhu tam vacchakam sakkaccam upanijjhāyati
translated: That bad monk looked at that calf with lust.

original: Atha kho so pāpupāsako taṁ pāpabhikkhuṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho saḥ pāpa upāsakaḥ tam pāpa bhikkhum etat avoca
translated: That bad lay follower said to that bad monk,

original: “kissa, bhante, ayyo imaṁ vacchakaṁ sakkaccaṁ upanijjhāyatī”ti?
analyzed: kissa bhante ayyo imam vacchakam sakkaccam upanijjhāyati iti
translated: “Why are you looking at this calf so intently, Sir?”

original: “Attho me, āvuso, imassa vacchakassa cammenā”ti.🔽Atha kho so pāpupāsako taṁ vacchakaṁ vadhitvā cammaṁ vidhunitvā tassa pāpabhikkhuno pādāsi.
analyzed: atthaḥ me āvuso imassa vacchakassa cammena ati  atha kho saḥ pāpa upāsakaḥ tam vacchakam vadhitvā cammam vidhunitvā tassa pāpa bhikkhunaḥ pādāsi
translated: “I need its hide.”🔽The lay follower then killed the calf, removed the hide, and gave it to the monk.

original: Atha kho so pāpabhikkhu taṁ cammaṁ saṅghāṭiyā paṭicchādetvā agamāsi.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ pāpa bhikkhu tam cammam saṅghāṭiyā paṭicchādetvā agamāsi
translated: The monk wrapped the hide in his outer robe and left.

original: Atha kho sā gāvī vacchagiddhinī taṁ pāpabhikkhuṁ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhi.
analyzed: atha kho sā gāvī vaccha giddhinī tam pāpa bhikkhum piṭṭhitaḥ piṭṭhitaḥ anubandhi
translated: The cow, who was still in heat, followed him.

original: Bhikkhū evamāhaṁsu—
analyzed: bhikkhū evam āhasu
translated: The monks asked him,

original: “kissa tyāyaṁ, āvuso, gāvī piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhī”ti?
analyzed: kissa tyāya āvuso gāvī piṭṭhitaḥ piṭṭhitaḥ anubandhi iti
translated: “Why is this cow following you?”

original: “Ahampi kho, āvuso, na jānāmi kena myāyaṁ gāvī piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhī”ti.
analyzed: aham pi kho āvuso na jānāmi kena myā ayam gāvī piṭṭhitaḥ piṭṭhitaḥ anubandhi iti
translated: “I don’t know.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena tassa pāpabhikkhuno saṅghāṭi lohitena makkhitā hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena tassa pāpa bhikkhuno saṅghāṭi lohitena makkhitā hoti
translated: But the outer robe of that monk was stained with blood.

original: Bhikkhū evamāhaṁsu—
analyzed: bhikkhū evam āhasu
translated: The monks asked him,

original: “ayaṁ pana te, āvuso, saṅghāṭi kiṁ katā”ti?
analyzed: ayam pana te āvuso saṅghāṭi kim katāti
translated: “What’s happened to your outer robe?”

original: Atha kho so pāpabhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ etamatthaṁ ārocesi.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ pāpa bhikkhu bhikkhūnam etam attham ārocesi
translated: He told the monks what had happened.

original: “Kiṁ pana tvaṁ, āvuso, pāṇātipāte samādapesī”ti?
analyzed: kim pana tvam āvuso pāṇātipāte samādapesi iti
translated: “But, friend, did you encourage him to kill himself?”

original: “Evamāvuso”ti.
analyzed: evam āvuso iti
translated: “Yes, friend.”

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: The monks of few desires who heard about this were angry and critical.

original: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhu pāṇātipāte samādapessati, nanu bhagavatā anekapariyāyena pāṇātipāto garahito, pāṇātipātā veramaṇī pasatthā”ti.🔽Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: katham hi nāma bhikkhu pāṇātipāte samādapessati nanu bhagavatā aneka pariyāyena pāṇātipātaḥ garahito pāṇātipātā veramaṇī pasatthā ti  atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesu
translated: “How could a monk encourage someone to kill themselves? Hasn’t the Buddha in many ways condemned killing, and praised abstention from killing?”🔽They rebuked that monk in many ways and then told the Buddha.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṁ sannipātāpetvā taṁ pāpabhikkhuṁ paṭipucchi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā tam pāpa bhikkhum paṭipucchi
translated: The Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned that bad monk:

original: “saccaṁ kira tvaṁ, bhikkhu, pāṇātipāte samādapesī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira tva bhikkhu pāṇātipāte samādapesi iti
translated: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti …pe…
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati pe
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

original: kathañhi nāma tvaṁ, moghapurisa, pāṇātipāte samādapessasi, nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena pāṇātipāto garahito, pāṇātipātā veramaṇī pasatthā.
analyzed: katham hi nāma tva mogha purisa pāṇātipāte samādapessasi nanu mayā mogha purisa aneka pariyāyena pāṇātipātaḥ garahito pāṇātipātā veramaṇī pasatthā
translated: “Foolish man, how could you do this? Haven’t I in many ways condemned killing, and praised abstention from killing?

original: Netaṁ, moghapurisa, appasannānaṁ vā pasādāya …pe…
analyzed: neta moghapurisa appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: This won’t inspire confidence in those without it …

original: vigarahitvā dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: vigarahitvā dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: After rebuking them and giving a teaching, he addressed the monks:

original: “na, bhikkhave, pāṇātipāte samādapetabbaṁ.
analyzed: na bhikkhave pāṇātipāte samādapetabba
translated: “You should not encourage killing living beings.

original: Yo samādapeyya, yathādhammo kāretabbo.
analyzed: yaḥ samādapeyya yathādhammaḥ kāretabbaḥ
translated: If you do, you should be dealt with according to the rule.

original: Na, bhikkhave, gocammaṁ dhāretabbaṁ.
analyzed: na bhikkhave go cammam dhāretabba
translated: You should not wear leather.

original: Yo dhāreyya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ dhāreyyaḥ āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Na ca, bhikkhave, kiñci cammaṁ dhāretabbaṁ.
analyzed: na ca bhikkhave kiñci cammam dhāretabba
translated: You should not wear any kind of leather.

original: Yo dhāreyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ dhāreyyaḥ āpatti dukkaṭassa ati
translated: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: 10. Gihivikatānuññātādi
analyzed: gihi vikata anuññāta ādi
translated: 1.1 The allowance for what is given by householders, etc.

original: Tena kho pana samayena manussānaṁ mañcampi pīṭhampi cammonaddhāni honti, cammavinaddhāni.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena manussānam mañcam pi pīṭham pi cammonaddhāni honti camma vinaddhāni
translated: At that time the beds and benches of the people belonged to the leather-workers.

original: Bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā nābhinisīdanti.
analyzed: bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā na abhinisīdanti
translated: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not sit down on them.

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gihivikataṁ abhinisīdituṁ, na tveva abhinipajjitun”ti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave gihi vikatam abhinisīditu na tu eva abhinipajjitum ti
translated: “I allow you to sit down on what is given by householders, but not to lie down on it.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena vihārā cammavaddhehi ogumphiyanti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena vihārā camma vaddhehi ogumphiyanti
translated: At that time the dwellings were fastened with leather straps.

original: Bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā nābhinisīdanti.
analyzed: bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā na abhinisīdanti
translated: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not sit down on them.

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bandhanamattaṁ abhinisīditun”ti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave bandhana mattam abhinisīditun ti
translated: “You should sit down as if you were tied up.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū saupāhanā gāmaṁ pavisanti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū sa upāhanāḥ gāmam pavisanti
translated: At that time the monks from the group of six entered the village wearing sandals.

original: Manussā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: manussāḥ ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: People complained and criticized them,

original: “seyyathāpi gihī kāmabhogino”ti.
analyzed: sā iyyathā api gihī
translated: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures.”

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Na, bhikkhave, saupāhanena gāmo pavisitabbo.
analyzed: na bhikkhave sa upāhanena gāmaḥ pavisitabbo
translated: “You should not enter the village wearing sandals.

original: Yo paviseyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ paviseyya āpatti dukkaṭassa ati
translated: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu gilāno hoti, na sakkoti vinā upāhanena gāmaṁ pavisituṁ.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññataraḥ bhikkhu gilānaḥ hoti na sakkoti vinā upāhanena gāmam pavisitu
translated: On one occasion a sick monk was unable to enter the village without sandals.

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānena bhikkhunā saupāhanena gāmaṁ pavisitun”ti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave gilānena bhikkhunā sa upāhanena gāmam pavisitun ti
translated: “I allow a sick monk to enter the village wearing sandals.”

original: 11. Soṇakuṭikaṇṇavatthu
analyzed: soṇa kuṭi kaṇṇavatthu
translated: The account of Soṇa Kuṭikaṇṇa

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahākaccāno avantīsu viharati kuraraghare papatake pabbate.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahākaccānaḥ avantīsu viharati kuraraghare papatake pabbate
translated: At that time Venerable Mahākaccāna was staying in Avantī in the Kuraraghara deer park.

original: Tena kho pana samayena soṇo upāsako kuṭikaṇṇo āyasmato mahākaccānassa upaṭṭhāko hoti.🔽Atha kho soṇo upāsako kuṭikaṇṇo yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena soṇaḥ upāsakaḥ kuṭikaṇṇaḥ āyasmataḥ mahākaccānassa upaṭṭhākaḥ hoti  atha kho soṇaḥ upāsakaḥ kuṭikaṇṇaḥ yena āyasmā mahākaccāno tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam mahākaccānam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: At that time the lay follower Soṇa Kuṭikaṇṇa was looking after Venerable Mahākaccāna.🔽So Soṇa went to Mahākaccāna, bowed, sat down,

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho soṇo upāsako kuṭikaṇṇo āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho soṇaḥ upāsakaḥ kuṭikaṇṇaḥ āyasmantam mahākaccānam etat avoca
translated: and said,

original: “yathā yathāhaṁ, bhante, ayyena mahākaccānena dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmi, nayidaṁ sukaraṁ agāraṁ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṁ ekantaparisuddhaṁ saṅkhalikhitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ.
analyzed: yathā yathā āha bhante ayyena mahākaccānena dhammam desitam ājānāmi na idam sukaram agāram ajjhāvasatā ekanta paripuṇṇam ekanta parisuddham saṅkha likhitam brahmacariyam caritu
translated: “Sir, as I understand the Teaching of Venerable Mahākaccāna, it’s not easy for one who lives at home to lead the spiritual life perfectly complete and pure as a polished conch shell.

original: Icchāmahaṁ, bhante, kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajituṁ.
analyzed: icchāmaha bhante kesa massum ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitu
translated: I wish to shave off my hair and beard, put on the ocher robes, and go forth into homelessness.

original: Pabbājetu maṁ, bhante, ayyo mahākaccāno”ti.
analyzed: pabbājetu ma bhante ayyaḥ mahā kaccāno ti
translated: Please give me the going forth.”

original: (…) “Dukkaraṁ kho, soṇa, yāvajīvaṁ ekaseyyaṁ ekabhattaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ.
analyzed: dukkaram kho soṇa yāvajīvam eka seyyam eka bhattam brahmacariyam caritu
translated: “It’s difficult to live alone, to eat only almsfood, and to practice celibacy for life.

original: Iṅgha tvaṁ, soṇa, tattheva agārikabhūto buddhānaṁ sāsanaṁ anuyuñja, kālayuttaṁ ekaseyyaṁ ekabhattaṁ brahmacariyan”ti.
analyzed: iṅgha tva soṇa tattha iva agārika bhūtaḥ buddhānam sāsanam anuyuñja kāla yuttam ekaseyyam ekabhattam brahmacariyanti
translated: So, Soṇa, continue living as a householder, enjoying sensual pleasures as long as you’re able. When it’s time, practice celibacy by living alone, eating only almsfood.”

original: Atha kho soṇassa upāsakassa kuṭikaṇṇassa yo ahosi pabbajjābhisaṅkhāro so paṭippassambhi.
analyzed: atha kho soṇassa upāsakassa kuṭikaṇṇassa yaḥ ahosi pabbajja abhisaṅkhāro so paṭippassambhi
translated: So Soṇa’s wish for the going forth was abandoned.

original: Dutiyampi kho soṇo upāsako kuṭikaṇṇo …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho soṇaḥ upāsako kuṭikaṇṇo pe
translated: A second time …

original: tatiyampi kho soṇo upāsako kuṭikaṇṇo yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho soṇo upāsako kuṭikaṇṇo āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho soṇaḥ upāsako kuṭikaṇṇaḥ yena āyasmā mahākaccāno tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam mahākaccānam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi 🔽ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho soṇaḥ upāsakaḥ kuṭikaṇṇaḥ āyasmantam mahākaccānam etat avoca
translated: A third time Soṇa asked for the going forth, and Mahākaccāna gave him the going forth and the full ordination.

original: “yathā yathāhaṁ, bhante, ayyena mahākaccānena dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmi, nayidaṁ sukaraṁ agāraṁ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṁ ekantaparisuddhaṁ saṅkhalikhitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ.
analyzed: yathā yathā āha bhante ayyena mahākaccānena dhammam desitam ājānāmi na idam sukaram agāram ajjhāvasatā ekanta paripuṇṇam ekanta parisuddham saṅkha likhitam brahmacariyam caritu
translated: “As I understand the Dhamma taught by the Venerable Mahā Kaccāna, it’s not easy for one who lives at home to lead the holy life utterly perfect and pure as a polished shell.

original: Icchāmahaṁ, bhante, kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajituṁ.
analyzed: icchāmaha bhante kesa massum ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitu
translated: I wish to cut off my hair and beard, put on the ocher robes, and go forth into homelessness.

original: Pabbājetu maṁ, bhante, ayyo mahākaccāno”ti.
analyzed: pabbājetu ma bhante ayyaḥ mahā kaccāno ti
translated: Venerable sir, may the Venerable Mahā Kaccāna give me the going forth.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā mahākaccāno soṇaṁ upāsakaṁ kuṭikaṇṇaṁ pabbājesi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā mahākaccāno soṇam upāsakam kuṭikaṇṇam pabbājesi
translated: Then the Venerable Mahā Kaccāna gave the lay follower Soṇa Koḷivisa the going forth.

original: Tena kho pana samayena avantidakkhiṇāpatho appabhikkhuko hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena avanti dakkhiṇāpathaḥ appabhikkhukaḥ hoti
translated: But at that time the southern region of Avantī was short of bhikkhus.

original: Atha kho āyasmā mahākaccāno tiṇṇaṁ vassānaṁ accayena kicchena kasirena tato tato dasavaggaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ sannipātāpetvā āyasmantaṁ soṇaṁ upasampādesi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā mahākaccānaḥ tiṇṇam vassānam accayena kicchena kasirena tatas tatas dasa vaggam bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā āyasmantam soṇam upasampādesi
translated: Then, after three years, the Venerable Mahā Kaccāna, with difficulty and with the greatest difficulty, gathered a Sangha of ten bhikkhus from here and there and gave full admission to the Venerable Soṇa.

original: 12. Mahākaccānassapañcavaraparidassana
translated: The exposition of the five aggregates

original: Atha kho āyasmato soṇassa vassaṁvuṭṭhassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ soṇassa vassa vuṭṭhassa rahaḥ gatassa paṭisallīnassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi
translated: Soon afterwards, when the rainy season was over, Soṇa had this thought:

original: “sutoyeva kho me so bhagavā ediso ca ediso cāti, na ca mayā sammukhā diṭṭho, gaccheyyāhaṁ taṁ bhagavantaṁ dassanāya arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ, sace maṁ upajjhāyo anujāneyyā”ti.
analyzed: sutoyā iva kho me so bhagavā ediso ca ediso ca ati na ca mayā sammukhā diṭṭhaḥ gaccheyya aham tam bhagavantam dassanāya arahantam sammāsambuddha sace mama upajjhāyaḥ anujāneyya ati
translated: “I’ve heard that the Buddha is like this and like that, but I haven’t seen it for myself. If my preceptor would allow it, I would go to see the Buddha, the Perfected and Fully Awakened One.”🔽Then, when it was evening, Soṇa got up from meditation, went to Mahākaccāna, bowed, sat down,

original: Atha kho āyasmā soṇo sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā soṇaḥ sāyanha samayam paṭisallānā vuṭṭhitaḥ yena āyasmā mahākaccāno tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam mahākaccānam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: and told him what he had thought.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā soṇo āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ etadavoca—🔽“idha mayhaṁ, bhante, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho āyasmā soṇaḥ āyasmantam mahākaccānam etat avoca 🔽idha bhante rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi
translated: “Soṇa, I’ve heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:

original: ‘sutoyeva kho me so bhagavā ediso ca ediso cāti, na ca mayā sammukhā diṭṭho, gaccheyyāhaṁ taṁ bhagavantaṁ dassanāya arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ, sace maṁ upajjhāyo anujāneyyā’ti;
analyzed: sutoyā iva kho me so bhagavā ediso ca ediso ca ati na ca mayā sammukhā diṭṭhaḥ gaccheyya aham tam bhagavantam dassanāya arahantam sammāsambuddha sace mama upajjhāyaḥ anujāneyya ati
translated: ‘I’ve heard that the Buddha is like this and like that, but I haven’t seen him face to face. If my preceptor would allow it, I would go to see the Buddha, the Perfected and Fully Awakened One.’

original: gaccheyyāhaṁ, bhante, taṁ bhagavantaṁ dassanāya arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ, sace maṁ upajjhāyo anujānātī”ti.
analyzed: gaccheyya āha bhante tam bhagavantam dassanāya arahantam sammāsambuddha sace mama upajjhāyaḥ anujānāti iti
translated: If my preceptor would allow it, I would go to see the Buddha, the Perfected and Fully Awakened One.”

original: “Sādhu sādhu, soṇa.
analyzed: sādhu sādhu soṇa
translated: “Good, good, Soṇa!

original: Gaccha tvaṁ, soṇa, taṁ bhagavantaṁ dassanāya arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ.
analyzed: gaccha tva soṇa tam bhagavantam dassanāya arahantam sammāsambuddha
translated: Go, Soṇa, to see the Buddha, the Perfected and Fully Awakened One.

original: Dakkhissasi tvaṁ, soṇa, taṁ bhagavantaṁ pāsādikaṁ pasādanīyaṁ santindriyaṁ santamānasaṁ uttamadamathasamathaṁ anuppattaṁ dantaṁ guttaṁ yatindriyaṁ nāgaṁ.
analyzed: dakkhissasi tva soṇa tam bhagavantam pāsādikam pasādanīyam sant indriyam santa mānasam uttama damatha samatham an uppattam dantam guttam yat indriyam nāga
translated: You will see that the Buddha is inspiring, inspiring to look at, with peaceful faculties and peaceful mind, attained to the supreme subduing and calm, tamed, guarded, restrained, with faculties and mind contained, a great man.

original: Tena hi tvaṁ, soṇa, mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vanda—
analyzed: tena hi tva soṇa mama vacanena bhagavataḥ pāde sirasā vanda
translated: So, Soṇa, in my name bow with your head to his feet.

original: ‘upajjhāyo me, bhante, āyasmā mahākaccāno bhagavato pāde sirasā vandatī’ti.
analyzed: upajjhāyaḥ me bhante āyasmā mahākaccānaḥ bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati iti
translated: Say to him: ‘My preceptor, Venerable Mahākaccāna, bows with his head to your feet.’

original: Evañca vadehi—
analyzed: evañca vadehi
translated: And say this:

original: ‘avantidakkhiṇāpatho, bhante, appabhikkhuko, tiṇṇaṁ me vassānaṁ accayena kicchena kasirena tato tato dasavaggaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ sannipātāpetvā upasampadaṁ alatthaṁ;
analyzed: avantidakkhiṇāpathaḥ bhante appabhikkhukaḥ tiṇṇam me vassānam accayena kicchena kasirena tatas tatas dasavaggam bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā upasampadam alattha
translated: ‘In the southern region of Avantī, there are few monks. After three years, with difficulty and hardship, I was able to gather a group of ten monks from here and there and I received the full ordination.

original: appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe appatarena gaṇena upasampadaṁ anujāneyya.
analyzed: appā iva nāma bhagavā avanti dakkhiṇāpathe appatarena gaṇena upasampadam anujāneyya
translated: I request the Buddha to allow the full ordination with a group of at least five monks in the southern region of Avantī.

original: Avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā gokaṇṭakahatā;
analyzed: avanti dakkhiṇāpathe bhante kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā go kaṇṭaka hatā
translated: In the southern region of Avantī, the ground is rough and uneven, and it is plowed by oxen.

original: appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe guṇaṅguṇūpāhanaṁ anujāneyya.
analyzed: appā iva nāma bhagavā avanti dakkhiṇāpathe guṇaṅguṇūpāhanam anujāneyya
translated: I request the Buddha to allow the wearing of sandals with many linings in the southern region of Avantī.

original: Avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, nahānagarukā manussā udakasuddhikā;🔽appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe dhuvanahānaṁ anujāneyya.
analyzed: avanti dakkhiṇāpathe bhante nahānagarukāḥ manussāḥ udaka suddhikāḥ  appā iva nāma bhagavā avanti dakkhiṇāpathe dhuvana hānam anujāneyya
translated: In the southern region of Avantī, people value bathing and purification by water.🔽I request the Buddha to allow regular bathing in the southern region of Avantī.

original: Avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, cammāni attharaṇāni, eḷakacammaṁ ajacammaṁ migacammaṁ.
analyzed: avanti dakkhiṇāpathe bhante cammāni attharaṇāni eḷaka cammam aja cammam miga camma
translated: In the southern region of Avantī, there are hides such as those of the black antelope, the goat, and the deer.

original: Seyyathāpi, bhante, majjhimesu janapadesu eragū moragū majjārū jantū;
analyzed: seyyathā api bhante majjhimesu janapadesu eragū moragū majjārū jantū
translated: Just as in the central Ganges plain, eragu, moragu, majjārū, and jantū are used,

original: evameva kho, bhante, avantidakkhiṇāpathe cammāni attharaṇāni, eḷakacammaṁ ajacammaṁ migacammaṁ;
analyzed: evam eva kho bhante avanti dakkhiṇāpathe cammāni attharaṇāni eḷaka cammam aja cammam miga camma
translated: In the same way, in the southern region of the country, there are hides for seats: goat hide, sheep hide, and deer hide.

original: appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe cammāni attharaṇāni anujāneyya, eḷakacammaṁ ajacammaṁ migacammaṁ.
analyzed: appā iva nāma bhagavā avanti dakkhiṇāpathe cammāni attharaṇāni anujāneyya eḷaka cammam aja cammam miga camma
translated: Perhaps the Buddha would allow hides for seats: goat hide, sheep hide, and deer hide.

original: Etarahi, bhante, manussā nissīmagatānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ cīvaraṁ denti—
analyzed: etarahi bhante manussāḥ nissīma gatānam bhikkhūnam cīvaram denti
translated: At present, people give robes to monks who have gone outside the monastery zone,

original: “imaṁ cīvaraṁ itthannāmassa demā”ti.
analyzed: imam cīvaram itthannāmassa dema iti
translated: saying, ‘We give this robe to so-and-so.’

original: Te āgantvā ārocenti—
analyzed: te āgantvā ārocenti
translated: When the monks return, they’re told,

original: “itthannāmehi te, āvuso, manussehi cīvaraṁ dinnan”ti te kukkuccāyantā na sādiyanti—
analyzed: itthannāmehi te āvuso manussehi cīvaram dinnanti te kukkuccāyantāḥ na sādiyanti
translated: ‘Friends, these people have given you a robe.’ But being afraid of wrongdoing, they don’t accept it,

original: “mā no nissaggiyaṁ ahosī”ti;
analyzed: mā naḥ nissaggiyam ahosi iti
translated: thinking, ‘Let’s not commit an offense entailing relinquishment.’

original: appeva nāma bhagavā cīvare pariyāyaṁ ācikkheyyā’”ti.
analyzed: appā iva nāma bhagavā cīvare pariyāyam ācikkheyya ati
translated: Perhaps the Buddha would give a progressive talk on robes.’”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti🔽kho āyasmā soṇo āyasmato mahākaccānassa paṭissutvā uṭṭhāyāsanā āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ
analyzed: eva bhanta iti  kho āyasmā soṇaḥ āyasmataḥ mahākaccānassa paṭissutvā uṭṭhāya āsanā āyasmantam mahākaccāna
translated: “Yes, Venerable Sir,”

original: abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā senāsanaṁ saṁsāmetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena sāvatthi tena pakkāmi.
analyzed: abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā senāsanam sasāmetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena sāvatthi tena pakkāmi
translated: Soṇo replied. He got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated Mahākaccāna with his right side toward him, and set his dwelling in order. He then took his bowl and robe and left for Sāvatthī.

original: Anupubbena yena sāvatthi jetavanaṁ anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāmo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: anupubbena yena sāvatthi jetavanam anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāmaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: He eventually arrived at Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery in Jeta’s Grove. He went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi—
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: The Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda,

original: “imassa, ānanda, āgantukassa bhikkhuno senāsanaṁ paññāpehī”ti.
analyzed: imassa ānanda āgantukassa bhikkhuno senāsanam paññāpehi iti
translated: “Ānanda, please prepare a dwelling for this newly arrived monk.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando—
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ
translated: Ānanda thought,

original: “yassa kho maṁ bhagavā āṇāpeti, ‘imassa, ānanda, āgantukassa bhikkhuno senāsanaṁ🔽paññāpehī’ti, icchati bhagavā tena bhikkhunā saddhiṁ ekavihāre vatthuṁ, icchati bhagavā
analyzed: yassa kho mam bhagavā āṇāpeti imassa ānanda āgantukassa bhikkhuno senāsana  paññāpehi iti icchati bhagavā tena bhikkhunā saddhim ekavihāre vatthu icchati bhagavā
translated: “The Buddha is instructing me to prepare a dwelling for this newly arrived monk.🔽He wants to stay in the same dwelling as him.

original: āyasmatā soṇena saddhiṁ ekavihāre vatthun”ti—
analyzed: āyasmatā soṇena saddhim eka vihāre vatthunti
translated: He wants to stay in the same dwelling as Venerable Soṇa.”

original: yasmiṁ vihāre bhagavā viharati tasmiṁ vihāre āyasmato soṇassa senāsanaṁ paññāpesi.
analyzed: yasmin vihāre bhagavā viharati tasmin vihāre āyasmataḥ soṇassa senāsanam paññāpesi
translated: So he prepared a dwelling for Soṇa in the same place as the Buddha.

original: Atha kho bhagavā bahudeva rattiṁ ajjhokāse vītināmetvā vihāraṁ pāvisi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā bahudeva rattim ajjhokāse vītināmetvā vihāram pāvisi
translated: The Buddha then spent much of the night outside.

original: Āyasmāpi kho soṇo bahudeva rattiṁ ajjhokāse vītināmetvā vihāraṁ pāvisi.
analyzed: āyasmā api kho soṇaḥ bahu deva rattim ajjhokāse vītināmetvā vihāram pāvisi
translated: Venerable Soṇa spent most of the night outside.

original: Atha kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṁ paccuṭṭhāya āyasmantaṁ soṇaṁ ajjhesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsa samayam paccuṭṭhāya āyasmantam soṇam ajjhesi
translated: Then, when it was the middle of the night, the Buddha got up and called Soṇa,

original: “paṭibhātu taṁ, bhikkhu, dhammo bhāsitun”ti.
analyzed: paṭibhātu ta bhikkhu dhammaḥ bhāsitunti
translated: saying, “Recite the Teaching, monk.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā soṇo bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā sabbāneva aṭṭhakavaggikāni sarena abhāsi.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho āyasmā soṇaḥ bhagavataḥ paṭissuṇitvā sabbān eva aṭṭhaka vaggikāni sarena abhāsi
translated: “Yes, Sir.” And after reciting all the Aṭṭhakavagga,

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmato soṇassa sarabhaññapariyosāne abbhānumodi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā āyasmataḥ soṇassa sarabhañña pariyosāne abbha anumodi
translated: the Buddha expressed his approval:

original: “sādhu sādhu, bhikkhu.
analyzed: sādhu sādhu bhikkhu
translated: “Good, good, monk!

original: Suggahitāni kho te, bhikkhu, aṭṭhakavaggikāni, sumanasikatāni sūpadhāritāni.
analyzed: suggahitāni kho te bhikkhu aṭṭhakavaggikāni sumanasikatāni su upadhāritāni
translated: You’ve learned the Aṭṭhakavagga well, remembered it well, and attended to it well in every way.

original: Kalyāṇiyāpi vācāya samannāgato, vissaṭṭhāya, anelagalāya, atthassa viññāpaniyā.
analyzed: kalyāṇiyā api vācāya samannāgataḥ vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā
translated: You’re endowed with a good voice, clear and articulate, and you make the meaning plain.

original: Kativassosi tvaṁ, bhikkhū”ti?
analyzed: kati vassā asi tva bhikkhu iti
translated: How many rains do you have, monk?”

original: “Ekavassohaṁ, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: ekavassā uha bhagavā ati
translated: “One, Sir.”

original: “Kissa pana tvaṁ, bhikkhu, evaṁ ciraṁ akāsī”ti?
analyzed: kissa pana tva bhikkhu evam ciram akāsi iti
translated: “But why have you taken so long?”

original: “Ciraṁ diṭṭho me, bhante, kāmesu ādīnavo, api ca sambādhā gharāvāsā bahukiccā bahukaraṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: ciram diṭṭhaḥ me bhante kāmesu ādīnavaḥ api ca sambādhāḥ ghara āvāsāḥ bahu kiccāḥ bahu karaṇīyā ati
translated: “I’ve seen the drawbacks of sensual pleasures for a long time, but I’m tied up with many duties and responsibilities.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṁ viditvā tāyaṁ velāyaṁ imaṁ udānaṁ udānesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etam attham viditvā tāyam velāyam imam udānam udānesi
translated: Knowing this, on that occasion the Buddha uttered this inspired utterance:

original: “Disvā ādīnavaṁ loke,
analyzed: disvā ādīnavam loke
translated: “Having seen the drawbacks in the world,

original: ñatvā dhammaṁ nirūpadhiṁ;
analyzed: ñatvā dhammam
translated: and knowing the Dhamma free from attachments,

original: Ariyo na ramatī pāpe,
analyzed: ariyaḥ na ramatī pāpe
translated: The noble one doesn’t delight in evil,

original: pāpe na ramatī sucī”ti.
analyzed: pāpe na ramatī suci iti
translated: and the pure one doesn’t delight in sensual pleasures.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā soṇo—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā soṇo
translated: Then Venerable Soṇa thought,

original: “paṭisammodati kho maṁ bhagavā, ayaṁ khvassa kālo yaṁ me upajjhāyo paridassī”ti—
analyzed: paṭisammodati kho mam bhagavā ayam khvassa kālaḥ yam me upajjhāyaḥ paridassi iti
translated: “The Buddha has greeted me. Now is the time for my preceptor to see me.”

original: uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: uṭṭhāya āsanā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā bhagavataḥ pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He got up from his seat, put his upper robe over one shoulder, bowed down with his head at the Buddha’s feet, and said,🔽“Sir, my preceptor, Venerable Mahākaccāna, bows down with his head at your feet.”

original: “upajjhāyo me, bhante, āyasmā mahākaccāno bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati, evañca vadeti avantidakkhiṇāpatho, bhante, appabhikkhuko.
analyzed: upajjhāyaḥ me bhante āyasmā mahākaccānaḥ bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati evam ca vadeti avanti dakkhiṇāpathaḥ bhante appabhikkhukaḥ
translated: “He says that the southern region of the Avadhūtaraja people has few monks.

original: Tiṇṇaṁ me vassānaṁ accayena kicchena kasirena tato tato dasavaggaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ
analyzed: tiṇṇam me vassānam accayena kicchena kasirena tatas tatas dasa vaggam bhikkhu saṅgha
translated: After three years, with difficulty and hardship, he gathered a sangha of ten monks from here and there.

original: sannipātāpetvā upasampadaṁ alatthaṁ, appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe appatarena
analyzed: sannipāta apetvā upasampadam alattha appā iva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe appatarena
translated: and received the full ordination, perhaps the Fortunate One will come to Avanti in the Southern Region with a small group of monks,

original: gaṇena upasampadaṁ anujāneyya.
analyzed: gaṇena upasampadam anujāneyya
translated: and we received the full ordination. Perhaps the Buddha would allow the full ordination with a smaller group in the southern region of the Dakkhiṇāgiri.

original: Avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā gokaṇṭakahatā;
analyzed: avanti dakkhiṇāpathe bhante kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā go kaṇṭaka hatā
translated: In the southern region of the Dakkhiṇāgiri, the ground is rough and cut up by the hooves of cattle.

original: appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe guṇaṅguṇūpāhanaṁ anujāneyya.
analyzed: appā iva nāma bhagavā avanti dakkhiṇāpathe guṇaṅguṇūpāhanam anujāneyya
translated: Perhaps the Buddha would allow sandals with many linings in the southern region of the Dakkhiṇāgiri.

original: Avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, nahānagarukā manussā udakasuddhikā, appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe dhuvanahānaṁ anujāneyya.🔽Avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, cammāni attharaṇāni, eḷakacammaṁ ajacammaṁ migacammaṁ.
analyzed: avanti dakkhiṇāpathe bhante nahāna garukāḥ manussāḥ udaka suddhikāḥ appā iva nāma bhagavā avanti dakkhiṇāpathe dhuvana hānam anujāneyya  avanti dakkhiṇāpathe bhante cammāni attharaṇāni eḷaka cammam aja cammam miga camma
translated: In the southern region of the Dakkhiṇāgiri, people value bathing and purity through water. Perhaps the Buddha would allow regular bathing in the southern region of the Dakkhiṇāgiri.🔽In the southern region of the Dakkhiṇāgiri, there are hides: goat hides, sheep hides, and deer hides.

original: Seyyathāpi, bhante, majjhimesu janapadesu eragū moragū majjārū jantū;🔽evameva kho, bhante, avantidakkhiṇāpathe cammāni attharaṇāni, eḷakacammaṁ ajacammaṁ migacammaṁ;
analyzed: seyyathā api bhante majjhimesu janapadesu eragū moragū majjārū jantū 🔽evam eva kho bhante avanti dakkhiṇāpathe cammāni attharaṇāni eḷaka cammam aja cammam miga camma
translated: Just as in the middle districts eragu, moragu, majjārū, and jantū are used for hides,🔽so too in the southern region of the Dakkhiṇāgiri, there are hides: goat hides, sheep hides, and deer hides.

original: appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe cammāni attharaṇāni anujāneyya, eḷakacammaṁ ajacammaṁ migacammaṁ.
analyzed: appā iva nāma bhagavā avanti dakkhiṇāpathe cammāni attharaṇāni anujāneyya eḷaka cammam aja cammam miga camma
translated: Perhaps the Buddha would allow leather from the southern region of Avantī.

original: Etarahi, bhante, manussā nissīmagatānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ cīvaraṁ denti—
analyzed: etarahi bhante manussāḥ nissīma gatānam bhikkhūnam cīvaram denti
translated: These days people give robe-cloth to monks who are outside the monastery zone,

original: ‘imaṁ cīvaraṁ itthannāmassa demā’ti.
analyzed: imam cīvaram itthannāmassa dema iti
translated: saying, ‘We give this robe-cloth to so-and-so.’

original: Te āgantvā ārocenti—
analyzed: te āgantvā ārocenti
translated: When the monks return, they’re told,

original: ‘itthannāmehi te, āvuso, manussehi cīvaraṁ dinnan’ti.
analyzed: itthannāmehi te āvuso manussehi cīvaram dinnanti
translated: ‘Your supporters have given you this robe-cloth.’
